question: Is it true that the poet Mayakovsky committed suicide?
answer: Yes, it is true, and even the record of his very last words is preserved: Don't shoot, comrades.

question: It is true that there is freedom of speech in USSR (in some versions, Russia), just like in the USA?
answer: In principle, yes. In the USA, you can stand in front of the White House and yell, “Down with Reagan!”, and you will not be punished. Equally, you can also stand in the Red Square in Moscow and yell, “Down with Reagan!”, and you will not be punished.

question: How many people of Russian origin live in Finland?
answer: There are enough to have a referendum.

question: Could an atomic bomb destroy our beloved town, Yerevan, with its splendid buildings and beautiful gardens?
answer: In principle, yes. But Moscow is by far a more beautiful city.

question: Why did they establish a Ministry of the Navy in landlocked Armenia. Do you have a sea?
answer: To spite Azerbaijan. They had established a Ministry of Culture.

question: What is the socialist friendship of nations?
answer: It's when Armenians, Russians, Ukrainians, and all other peoples of the USSR unite in a brotherly manner and all together set out to beat up the Azeris.

question: Is it correct that Grigori Grigorievich Grigoriev won a luxury car at the All-Union Championship in Moscow?
answer: In principle, yes. But first of all it was not Grigori Grigorievich Grigoriev, but Vassili Vassilievich Vassiliev; second, it was not at the All-Union Championship in Moscow, but at a Collective Farm Sports Festival in Smolensk; third, it was not a car, but a bicycle; and fourth he didn't win it, but rather it was stolen from him.

question: When will life be better in the USSR?
answer: In the USSR, life already has been better.
